extent.value: (3 document cases, 1 binder, 1 flat box, and 1 oversized box)

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: Epoxy was an art collective that specialized in collaborative, multi-media, and experimental projects. Active between the years of 1982 and around 1992, Epoxy was founded by Ming Fay, Jerry Kwan, Kwok, Bing Lee, Kang Lok Chung, and Eric Chan â€” all New York City based visual artists with cultural ties to Hong Kong. The Archive includes original artwork, photographs, slides, press releases, press coverage, some business files and correspondence, and internal meeting minutes as well as other writings.

p.value: Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers.

Published citations should take the following form:
                <lb/>
                <lb/> Identification of item, date (if known); Epoxy Art Group Records; MSS 367; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

Between the years 1982 until round 1992, the group held routine meetings and mounted exhibits approximately twice a year in a range of venues, including Kwok Gallery, the Sabrina Fung Gallery, the Alternative Gallery, and the New Museum. Epoxy's exhibitions, as well as their less conventional projects and public art works, include Works on the Wall (1983), Ball Show (1983), Pink Works (1984), Erotica (1984), Myths (1985), Roots of Reality (1985), Dragon, Eagle, Apple, and Pear (an outdoor art show at the Red Spot, 1986-7), Out of Context (1987), 36 Tactics (1988), 18 Layers of Hell (1988), and a public art exhibit in conjunction with REPOhistory (1990-1992).
<emph render="bold">Series III: Media</emph> Epoxy Art Group Record's includes one cassette tape, which has been separated as its own series primarily for preservation reasons.

subject.value: Asian American artists |z New York (State) |z New York |v Societies.

These files document Epoxy's exhibitions as well as less conventional projects and public art works between the years of 1983-1992.

II: Administrative and Organizational Records Scope and Content

This series is divided into three subseries.The first series contains a a range of material, including articles, press releases, photographs, artwork, and more. The second series consists of material that was removed from a blue green binder and rehoused in an archival binder. It includes press releases and photographs of Epoxy members. Finally, the third series contains three stamps and two stamp pads.
